segments.text: I notice the boy is balancing on that stool, and it’s making me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so absorbed in her task, it’s almost like she’s in another world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is just pouring out of that sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole floor is going to be soaked, and she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kids are going to get away with those cookies, and she won’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the light comes in through the window makes everything look so calm, but it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy will actually fall or if he’ll manage to keep his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing is like a disaster movie in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away—it’s too unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR
